name: Mac Dre
description:
'''Andre Louis Hicks''' (July 6, 1970 â€“ November 1, 2004), known professionally as '''Mac Dre''', was an American rapper, songwriter, and record producer from [[Vallejo, California]]. He was an instrumental figure in the emergence of [[hyphy]], a cultural movement in the [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] [[hip-hop]] scene that emerged in the early 2000s. Hicks is considered one of the movement's key pioneers that fueled its popularity into mainstream, releasing songs with fast-paced rhymes and basslines that inspired a new style of dance. As the founder of the independent record label [[Thizz Entertainment]], Hicks recorded dozens of albums and gave aspiring rappers an outlet to release albums locally.

On November 1, 2004, Hicks was shot and killed by an unknown assailant after a performance in [[Kansas City, Missouri]], a case which remains unsolved.
